etymology.description: Pictogram: a row of steps on a hill; the steps remain visible in the upper part 𠂤; original form 𨸏.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts steps cut into a hillside, with the tiered strokes suggesting a path or terracing up a mound. This imagery underlies meanings like “mound” or “hill” and informs its use as the left-side radical in terrain-related characters.

examples.chinese: 这片土地多丘阜(這片土地多丘阜)。
examples.english: This stretch of land has many hills and mounds.

examples.chinese: 村后有一座小山阜(村後有一座小山阜)。
examples.pinyin: Cūn hòu yǒu yī zuò xiǎo shānfù.
examples.english: There is a small hill behind the village.

examples.chinese: 工人沿着阜上的台阶缓缓登高(工人沿著阜上的台階緩緩登高)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngrén yánzhe fù shàng de táijiē huǎnhuǎn dēnggāo.
examples.english: Workers slowly ascended along the steps on the hill.
